question.title: How to change a verb to its noun form (gerund) using the Stanford-NLP library?
question.body:
I have individual verbs in a collection of String objects (thanks to How to find whether a word is a noun or a verb using Stanford parser?). Now for each, I would like to obtain the appropriate noun form (gerund) of the verb.

For example, for each of the following strings

String[] words = {"ran", "run", "runs"};

I would like to be able to retrieve the gerund, i.e. "running".

How can this be done using the Stanford-NLP Java library when passed the individual Strings rather than a whole block of text?

question_comments.body: note: 1) a much more generalized (in terms of conversion types and solution-technology scope) is available at How can I get a morphological variation of a lemma in a Java program?. 2) this question is/was being discussed on meta and has undergone several improvements from its original revision with community help.
